intro: Aster prenanthoides f. milwaukeensis, commonly known as the Milwaukee aster, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the northeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and lance-shaped, gray-green leaves. Its showy purple to blue flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This variant is distinguished by its more robust growth and broader leaves compared to the typical form of Aster prenanthoides.
